meanings.definition: The study of the relationships between humans and their environments, including the ways in which different cultures understand and use plants and animals.
meanings.sent1: Ethnobiologies help us learn how people interact with nature.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in ethnobiologies explore how cultures utilize natural resources.
meanings.sent3: Studying ethnobiologies can reveal fascinating insights into human-nature connections.
meanings.sent4: In the vast field of knowledge, ethnobiologies act as a bridge between culture and ecology.
meanings.sent5: The intricate web of ethnobiologies showcases the intricate dance between humans and their surroundings.

meanings.definition: The scientific study of how different cultures classify and use plants and animals.
meanings.sent1: Understanding ethnobiologies helps us appreciate cultural diversity in plant and animal use.
meanings.sent2: Ethnobiologies provide valuable insights into traditional knowledge systems.
meanings.sent3: A humorous take on ethnobiologies could involve a mix-up in plant classifications.
meanings.sent4: Metaphorically speaking, ethnobiologies are like keys unlocking the secrets of cultural plant use.
meanings.sent5: The vivid tapestry of ethnobiologies paints a picture of cultural relationships with nature.
